title: Ehud Barak
summary: Ehud Barak (Hebrew: אֵהוּד בָּרָק‎ , born Ehud Brog; 12 February 1942) is an Israeli general and politician who served as the tenth prime minister from 1999 to 2001. He was leader of the Labor Party until January 2011.[1] He previously held the posts of defense minister and deputy prime minister under Ehud Olmert and then in Benjamin Netanyahu's second government from 2007 to 2013, as he retired from politics at the end of the tenure,[2] though he returned in June 2019 with the formation of a new party.[3]
